description: This Python script is part of a code generation system for JSON-RPC API interfaces. It defines a function EmitHelperCode that, given an emitter, logs, and a root schema object, generates C++ header and source code for JSON-RPC API classes, including registration, unregistration, and method/property/event stubs. The code handles various method types like functions, properties, and notifications, and supports emitting registration routines, API stubs, and event handling code.

classes.name: JsonNotification
classes.description: Represents a notification method in the JSON-RPC schema, including properties like is_status_listener and json_name.

classes.name: JsonProperty
classes.description: Represents a property (getter/setter) in the JSON-RPC schema, including flags for read-only or write-only.

classes.name: JsonMethod
classes.description: Represents a method/function in the JSON-RPC schema, including parameters, result type, errors, and endpoint names.

methods.name: EmitHelperCode(log, root, emit, header_file)
methods.description: Main function that produces C++ code for JSON-RPC interfaces based on a schema root object, emitting header includes, registration functions, API stubs, and event handlers.
